title: Why Axel Tuanzebe has missed Man Utd's clash vs Liverpool
text:
Axel Tuanzebe has missed Manchester United’s clash against Liverpool (AFP/Getty Images)

Axel Tuanzebe was forced to pull out of Manchester United’s clash against Liverpool after suffering an injury during the warm-up.

The 21-year-old was initially named as part of a back three alongside Harry Maguire and Victor Lindelof for Sunday’s match at Old Trafford.

But Tuanzebe was unable to make kick-off after suffering a hip strain and was replaced in Ole Gunnar Solskjaer’s starting line-up by Marcos Rojo.

The defender’s latest setback adds to Solskjaer’s injury list with Paul Pogba, Jesse Lingard and Luke Shaw all unable to make the bench against Liverpool.

Tuanzebe is now sidelined with a hip injury ( Getty Images)

Advertisement

Advertisement

Speaking before the game, Solskjaer stressed his desire to make his players more ‘robust’.

‘I have seen lots of positives already from the start of the season,’ said the United manager.

‘We are working hard to make our players much more robust and our pre-season has certainly helped with that.’
